action.action-desc: Ms. Norton introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on the Judiciary

form.official-title: To amend title 28, United States Code, to change the residency requirements for certain officials serving in the District of Columbia, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the District of Columbia Federal Officials Residency Equality Act of 2015.

section.header: Residency requirements for certain officials serving in the District of Columbia

subsection.text: Section 134 of title 28, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: in the first sentence of subsection (b)—

subparagraph.text: by striking the District of Columbia, the Southern District of New York, and and inserting the Southern District of New York and; and
by striking for which he and inserting for which he or she; and

paragraph.text: in subsection (c), by striking his each place it appears and inserting his or her.

subsection.text: Section 545(a) of title 28, United States Code, is amended by striking the first sentence and inserting Each United States attorney shall reside in the district for which he or she is appointed, except that those officers of the Southern District of New York and the Eastern District of New York may reside within 20 miles thereof..
Section 561(e)(1) of title 28, United States Code, is amended to read as follows:

paragraph.text: the marshal for the Southern District of New York may reside within 20 miles of the district; and

subsection.text: The amendments made by this section shall take effect on the date that is one year after the date of the enactment of this Act.
